modelIdentification.name: NETN-ORG
modelIdentification.purpose: The NATO Education and Training Organization (NETN-ORG) module provides a standard way to represent organizations in the simulation scenario and their relationships and structure. The relationships include unit command structure, relationships between organizations, unit equipment, and installations.
modelIdentification.description:
Simulation of elements of an organization requires knowledge of the intra-organizational relationship, e.g. superior, subordinate, and iter-organizational relationships with other organizations, e.g. friendly or hostile. The NETN-ORG supports initialization and organizations' dynamic change of this information.
The specification is based on IEEE 1516 High Level Architecture (HLA) Object Model Template (OMT) and supports interoperability in a federated simulation (federation) based on HLA. In addition to the FOM Module, a file-based data storage and interchange format is defined based on SISO-STD-007-2008 Military Scenario Definition Language (MSDL). The NETN-ORG XML schema defines elements to capture units, equipment items, relationships, and initial modelling responsibilities.
modelIdentification.useLimitation: Use the NETN-ORG information to: * initialize simulated entities * perform disaggregation, aggregation, divide and merge actions using NETN-MRM * change organizational relationships * capture simulated unit and equipment state as snapshots
modelIdentification.useHistory: v1.0 - Initial version developed by MSG-163. Release included in NETN-FOM v3.0
v2.0 - Updated version developed by MSG-191. Release included in NETN-FOM v4.0

poc.pocName: MSG-163 Evolution of NATO Standards for Federated Simulation
MSG-191 NATO Standards for Federated Simulation and Services for Integration, Verification and Certification

objectClass.name: ORG_Root
objectClass.semantics: The object class for all NETN-ORG object classes

attribute.name: Name
attribute.semantics: Required. A unique name. Max 255 characters.

objectClass.name: OrganizationElement
objectClass.semantics: An object class for all NETN-ORG organizational elements

attribute.name: Organization
attribute.semantics: Required: A reference to the organization the element is affiliated with.

attribute.name: EntityType
attribute.semantics: Required. SISO-REF-010 code for entity type definitions. If unknown, use 0.0.0.0.0.0.0.

attribute.name: SymbolId
attribute.semantics: Required. A symbol identifier.

attribute.name: Location
attribute.semantics: Required. The geographic location of the element.

objectClass.name: Equipment
objectClass.semantics: Equipment represents individual physical items identified in the scenario, including platforms and sensors.

attribute.name: HoldingUnit
attribute.semantics: Optional: A reference to the unit to which this equipment belongs. The default is that the equipment does not belong to a specific unit.

attribute.name: MountedOn
attribute.semantics: Optional. Reference to another equipment item on which this item is mounted or attached.

attribute.name: SymbolAmplification
attribute.semantics: Optional. Text amplifications for the symbol.

objectClass.name: Unit
objectClass.semantics: A unit represents an element at a specified level in the organization. An organizational unit can contain subunits and can belong to a superior unit. A unit consists of equipment, personnel and supplies; these holdings can belong directly to the unit or indirectly as a holding of a subunit.

attribute.name: SuperiorUnit
attribute.semantics: Optional: A reference to a superior unit within the organization. The default is that this unit does not have a superior.

attribute.name: SymbolAmplification
attribute.semantics: Optional. Text amplifications for the symbol.

attribute.name: Echelon
attribute.semantics: Optional. Symbol modifier identifying the command level. Default NONE.

attribute.name: IsHq
attribute.semantics: Optional. Indicate whether the unit has a command function, e.g. if it is an HQ or not.

attribute.name: Holdings
attribute.semantics: Optional. A set of holdings of the unit. The default is an empty list.

attribute.name: EmbarkedIn
attribute.semantics: Optional. A reference to a unit or equipment carrying/transporting the unit. The default value is 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 (UUID with all zeros), indicating that the unit is not embarked in or mounted on any other unit or equipment.

attribute.name: Formation
attribute.semantics: Optional. Formation of this unit.

objectClass.name: Installation
objectClass.semantics: Installations are facilities, e.g. harbours, airfields, or engineering objects, e.g. minefields.

attribute.name: UnitInCommand
attribute.semantics: Optional: A reference to a unit in charge of this installation. The default is that no specific unit is in charge of the installation.

attribute.name: SymbolAmplification
attribute.semantics: Optional. Text amplifications for the symbol.

objectClass.name: Organization
objectClass.semantics: An organization have relationships with other organizations. Units belonging to different organizations have the same relationship as the organizations they belong to. However, the relationships between organizations can be asymmetrical, e.g. Side A can be hostile to B while B is neutral to A. Furthermore, the relation may change during a federation execution.

attribute.name: Relations
attribute.semantics: Optional. The relations with other organizations. The federation agreements specify default relationship.

attribute.name: ForceIdentifier
attribute.semantics: Required: A force identifier indicate a special relationship with an organization in the scenario designated as the default perspective of the scenario. The force identifier applies to all simulated entities representing an organizational element belonging to the organization and is a required attribute for all `PhysicalEntity` and `AggregateEntity` objects in the federation.

attribute.name: Nation
attribute.semantics: Optional: A textual description of the nation the organization affiliates with.

enumeratedData.name: FormationLocationTypeEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumerated choice for the method to correlate formation to location as the centre of mass or lead element.

enumeratedData.name: FormationTypeEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumerated choice for the type of formation being Ground, Air, Surface or Subsurface.

enumeratedData.name: GroundFormationTypeEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: Specifies the formations for ground units.

enumeratedData.name: ForceIDEnum8
enumeratedData.semantics: The identification of the force that the entity belongs to.

fixedRecordData.name: Relation
fixedRecordData.semantics: The specific value that represents the perceived hostility status.

field.name: Affiliate
field.semantics: The force that the current force has a relation to

field.name: Relationship
field.semantics: The level of the relation

fixedRecordData.name: Holding
fixedRecordData.semantics: Static and dynamic data about the holding.

field.name: OperationalCount
field.semantics: The number of specific OBJECT-TYPEs a specific OBJECT-ITEM has available for operations

field.name: OnHandQuantity
field.semantics: Current number of the holding.

field.name: RequiredOnHandQuantity
field.semantics: The required number of the holding.

field.name: IsEquipment
field.semantics: True if is equipment, false for expendables.

field.name: EntityType
field.semantics: DIS enumeration. Use 0.0.0.0.0.0.0 when not defined.

field.name: ReinforcedOrReduced
field.semantics: A text amplifier in a unit symbol that displays (+) for reinforced, (-) for reduced, (Â±) reinforced and reduced.

field.name: StaffComments
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations.

field.name: AdditionalInformation
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations.

field.name: EvaluationRating
field.semantics:
A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that consists of a one-letter reliability rating and a one-number credibility rating.
Reliability Ratings: A-completely reliable B-usually reliable C-fairly reliable D-not usually reliable E-unreliable F-reliability cannot be judged
Credibility Ratings: 1-confirmed by other sources 2-probably true 3-possibly true 4-doubtfully true 5-improbable 6-truth cannot be judged.

field.name: CombatEffectiveness
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units and installations that indicates unit effectiveness or installation capability.

field.name: HigherFormation
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units that indicates number or title of higher echelon command (corps are designated by Roman numerals).

field.name: IFF_SIF_AIS
field.semantics: A text amplifier displaying IFF/SIF/AIS identification modes and codes.

field.name: UniqueDesignation
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number. Identifies acquisitions number when used with SIGINT symbology.

field.name: SpecialHeadquarters
field.semantics: A text modifier for a unit's special C2 Headquarters.

field.name: EngagementBarText
field.semantics: A text amplifier placed immediately atop the symbol in the engagement bar. May denote, 1) local/remote status; 2) engagement status; and 3) weapon type.

field.name: Quantity
field.semantics: A text amplifier in an equipment symbol that identifies the number of items present.

field.name: StaffComments
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations.

field.name: AdditionalInformation
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations.

field.name: EvaluationRating
field.semantics:
A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that consists of a one-letter reliability rating and a one-number credibility rating.
Reliability Ratings: A-completely reliable B-usually reliable C-fairly reliable D-not usually reliable E-unreliable F-reliability cannot be judged
Credibility Ratings: 1-confirmed by other sources 2-probably true 3-possibly true 4-doubtfully true 5-improbable 6-truth cannot be judged.

field.name: SignatureEquipment
field.semantics: A text amplifier for hostile equipment; â!â indicates detectable electronic signatures.

field.name: Hostile
field.semantics: A text amplifier for equipment; letters "ENY" denote hostile symbols.

field.name: IFF_SIF_AIS
field.semantics: A text amplifier displaying IFF/SIF/AIS identification modes and codes.

field.name: UniqueDesignation
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number. Identifies acquisitions number when used with SIGINT symbology.

field.name: EquipmentType
field.semantics: A text amplifier for equipment that indicates types of equipment.

field.name: EngagementBarText
field.semantics: A text amplifier placed immediately atop the symbol in the engagement bar. May denote, 1) local/remote status; 2) engagement status; and 3) weapon type.

field.name: StaffComments
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations.

field.name: AdditionalInformation
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations.

field.name: EvaluationRating
field.semantics:
A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that consists of a one-letter reliability rating and a one-number credibility rating.
Reliability Ratings: A-completely reliable B-usually reliable C-fairly reliable D-not usually reliable E-unreliable F-reliability cannot be judged
Credibility Ratings: 1-confirmed by other sources 2-probably true 3-possibly true 4-doubtfully true 5-improbable 6-truth cannot be judged.

field.name: CombatEffectiveness
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units and installations that indicates unit effectiveness or installation capability.

field.name: IFF_SIF_AIS
field.semantics: A text amplifier displaying IFF/SIF/AIS identification modes and codes.

field.name: UniqueDesignation
field.semantics: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number. Identifies acquisitions number when used with SIGINT symbology.

field.name: EngagementBarText
field.semantics: A text amplifier placed immediately atop the symbol in the engagement bar. May denote, 1) local/remote status; 2) engagement status; and 3) weapon type.

field.name: FormationLocationType
field.semantics: The method used to correlate formation to location as center of mass or lead element.

field.name: FormationSpacing
field.semantics: The default spacing in metres between subordinate elements one echelon below.

field.name: FormationOrientation
field.semantics: Orientation in compass degrees for unit formations and equipment.

field.name: FormationData
field.semantics: The formation data specific to the specified formation type.

variantRecordData.name: FormationDataStruct
variantRecordData.semantics: Struct for enumerated choice for the type of formation being Ground, Air, Surface or Subsurface.

note.label: netn-org_1
note.semantics:
* Replaced `ORG_Root` attribute `UniqueId` with NETN-BASE `HLAobjectRoot` attribute `UniqueId` * Added `ORG_Root` attribute `Name`
* Added object class `OrganizationElement`
* Replaced `Unit` attribute `Name` with `ORG_Root` attribute `Name` * Replaced `Unit` attribute `Force` with `OrganizationElement` attribute `Organization` * Replaced `Unit` attribute `EntityType` with `OrganizationElement` attribute `EntityType` * Replaced `Unit` attribute `SymbolId` with `OrganizationElement` attribute `SymbolId` * Replaced `Unit` attribute `Disposition` with `OrganizationElement` attribute `Location` * Replaced `Unit` attribute `CommunicationNetworks` with NETN-COM `Unit` attribute `CommunicationNetworks`
* Renamed object class `EquipmentItem` to `Equipment` * Replaced `EquipmentItem` attribute `Name` with `ORG_Root` attribute `Name` * Replaced `EquipmentItem` attribute `EntityType` with `OrganizationElement` attribute `EntityType` * Removed `EquipmentItem` attribute `NatoStockNumber` * Replaced `EquipmentItem` attribute `SymbolId` with `OrganizationElement` attribute `SymbolId` * Replaced `EquipmentItem` attribute `Disposition` with `OrganizationElement` attribute `Location` * Replaced `EquipmentItem` attribute `CommunicationNetworks` with NETN-COM `Equipment` attribute `CommunicationNetworks` * Removed `EquipmentItem` attribute `Resolution`
* Replaced `Installation` attribute `Name` with `ORG_Root` attribute `Name` * Renamed `Installation` attribute `Owner` to `UnitInCommand` * Replaced `Installation` attribute `EntityType` with `OrganizationElement` attribute `EntityType` * Replaced `Installation` attribute `SymbolId` with `OrganizationElement` attribute `SymbolId` * Replaced `Installation` attribute `Location` with `OrganizationElement` attribute `Location`
* Renamed object class `Force` to `Organization` * Replaced `Force` attribute `Name` with `ORG_Root` attribute `Name` * Added `Organization` attribute `ForceIdentifier` * Added `Organization` attribute `Nation`
* Moved object class `FederateApplication` to NETN-TMR
* Removed datatype `ArrayOfCommunicationNetworks` * Removed datatype `CommunicationNetworkStruct` * Removed datatype `CommunicationServiceTypeEnum32` * Removed datatype `DispositionStruct` * Added datatype `ForceIDEnum8` * Removed datatype `FormationInt32` * Removed datatype `FormationPositionStruct` * Replaced datatype `HostilityStatusCodeEnum32` with NETN-BASE datatype `HostilityStatusCodeEnum32` * Removed datatype `ModelResolutionTypeEnum32` * Removed datatype `NatoStockNumberArray13` * Replaced datatype `Text255` with `HLAunicodeString`

note.label: netn-org_2
note.semantics:
## Overview
Use the NETN-ORG FOM module to represent organizations and their internal structure, relationships, associated units, equipment, and installations.
Dynamic organizational changes may include new and or rearranged unit structure or changes in the relationships with other organizations.
In a simulation, not all units, equipment and installations have a corresponding simulation entity in the federation. Which elements to represent as simulated entities are determined by the current modelling responsibility described in NETN-TMR and dynamic changes in the level of aggregation described in NETN-MRM.
The NETN-ORG organization elements are the basis for the initialization of simulated entities, e.g. `Platforms` or `AggregateEntity` objects. Therefore, updates of NETN-ORG objects should be considered a re-initialization of any associate simulation entity. E.g. updating the `Unit` attribute `Holdings` should be reflected in an `AggregateEntity` representing the unit.
